title: Bangladesh sees dramatic rise in lightning deaths linked to climate change
claim: On the day he thought he'd be celebrating his wedding, Mamun buried 16 of his relatives.

title: How climate change worsens heatwaves, droughts, wildfires and floods
claim: Climate change is the most likely explanation for why Dubai has been experiencing increasingly heavy rainfall events, a new study says.

title: What is climate change? A really simple guide
claim: Human activities are causing world temperatures to rise, with more intense heatwaves and rising sea-levels among the consequences.

title: Kenyan farmer: 'I'm afraid that elephants will kill me'
claim: In our series of letters from African journalists, Ismail Einashe reflects on how Kenya's changing climate is bringing animals and humans into greater conflict.

title: Climate change could affect timekeeping, study says
claim: Climate change is affecting the speed of the Earth's rotation and could impact how we keep time, a study says.

title: Fears for the future of the great British pint of beer
claim: Climate change threatens to "call time" on the great British pint.

title: Road schemes in Wales could be considered, says Ken Skates
claim: New road schemes that reflect the climate emergency and put Wales at the forefront of design could be considered, the new transport secretary said.

title: Banana prices to go up as temperatures rise, says expert
claim: Bananas are set to get more expensive as climate change hits a much-loved fruit, one of the world's top experts from the industry tells BBC News.

title: TV soaps to swap characters to highlight climate change
claim: If you see one of the BBC Doctors walk on to the set of Corrie next month, do not adjust your set.

title: Climate change: The 'insane' plan to save the Arctic's sea-ice
claim: Perched on sea-ice off Canada's northern coast, parka-clad scientists watch saltwater pump out over the frozen ocean.

title: Climate change: Sabrina Lee quits buying new clothes
claim: With her job as a TV weather presenter, it would be easy for Sabrina Lee to justify buying new clothes for work on a regular basis.

title: Easter eggs costs rise as climate change hits crops
claim: You may have noticed that Easter eggs are more expensive this year.

title: Resigning ex-minister Chris Skidmore wrong on climate, says Jeremy Hunt
claim: Jeremy Hunt has said he "profoundly" disagrees with former Conservative minister Chris Skidmore who quit as an MP over the government's energy plans.

title: More climate records fall in world's warmest February
claim: Last month was the world's warmest February in modern times, the EU's climate service says, extending the run of monthly records to nine in a row.

title: Yvonne Aki-Sawyerr - the tree-planting mayor of Sierra Leone's capital Freetown
claim: Yvonne Aki-Sawyerr has made a name for herself as a tree-planting mayor of a West African city on the brink of a climate emergency.

title: Swiss ski resort RÃ¼schegg Eywald falls victim to climate change
claim: Just half an hour's drive from my house in Bern is a ski resort once so popular it was dubbed "Little Grindelwald", after its more famous Alpine near-neighbour at the foot of the Eiger.

title: Rare dragonfly spreads its wings from Norfolk and Suffolk
claim: A once-rare type of dragonfly may have been aided by climate change, the Broads Authority has said.

title: Climate change: 'Ice bumps' reveal history of Antarctic melting
claim: Scientists say they now have a better idea of exactly where and when the margin of Antarctica started melting.

title: Pioneering European ERS-2 satellite burns up over Pacific
claim: A European satellite that pioneered many of the technologies used to monitor the planet and its climate has fallen to Earth.

title: Climate change: Plan to capture, ship and bury power station's CO2
claim: Plans to lay new undersea pipes to carry carbon emissions from one of Europe's largest gas power stations have been unveiled.

title: Climate change: Polar bears face starvation threat as ice melts
claim: Some polar bears face starvation as the Arctic sea ice melts because they are unable to adapt their diets to living on land, scientists have found.

title: Kuenssberg: Are the politics of climate change going out of fashion?
claim: What's in vogue?

title: What is the Paris climate agreement and why does 1.5C matter?
claim: For the first time, global warming has exceeded 1.5C across an entire year, according to the EU's climate service.

title: World's first year-long breach of key 1.5C warming limit
claim: For the first time, global warming has exceeded 1.5C across an entire year, according to the EU's climate service.

title: Antarctica mysteries to be mapped by robot plane
claim: A team of scientists and engineers have landed in Antarctica to test a drone that will help experts forecast the impacts of climate change.

title: Greta Thunberg cleared after unlawful protest arrest
claim: Greta Thunberg and four co-defendants have been found not guilty of breaking the law when they refused to follow police instructions to move on during a climate protest.

title: Greta Thunberg outside court: We must remember who real enemy is
claim: Climate campaigner Greta Thunberg has defended climate activists facing prosecution in court, saying "we must remember who the real enemy is".
